alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 12:50PM CST until February 28 at 9:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Turkey River at Elkader affecting Clayton County. Turkey River at Garber affecting Clayton County. .Heavy rain has fallen on a primed snowpack leading to increasing melt. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turkey River at Elkader. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM CST Monday the stage was 11.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 14.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It is then expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 06/29/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. Next forecast issuance at 9pm CST.
